intro: Rhododendron vidalii subsp. brachystemon, commonly known as the Himalayan rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Asia, particularly in Nepal and Bhutan. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in high-altitude forests and alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Its subspecies distinction is based on differences in leaf morphology and floral structure compared to the main species.
